acknowledgments.summary: reporting these vulnerabilities to Distributed Data Systems and CISA

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow a user with administrative privileges in WebHMI to execute arbitrary OS commands or impact other logged in users.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Commercial Facilities, Critical Manufacturing, Food and Agriculture, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A user with administrative privileges in WebHMI can store a script that could impact other logged in users.CVE-2022-2254 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Contact Distributed Data Systems for additional details regarding these vulnerabilities and their mitigations.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

notes.text: A user with administrative privileges in WebHMI may send OS commands to execute on the host server.CVE-2022-2253 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Contact Distributed Data Systems for additional details regarding these vulnerabilities and their mitigations.
